paper.title: Risk Automatic Prediction for Social Economy Companies Using Camels
paper.abstract: Governments have to supervise and inspect social economy enterprises (SEEs). However, inspecting all SEEs is not possible due to the large number of SEEs and the low number of inspectors in general. We proposed a prediction model based on a machine learning approach. The method was trained with the random forest algorithm with historical data provided by each SEE. Three consecutive periods of data were concatenated. The proposed method uses these periods as input data and predicts the risk of each SEE in the fourth period. The model achieved 76% overall accuracy. In addition, it obtained good accuracy in predicting the high risk of a SEE. We found that the legal nature and the variation of the past-due portfolio are good predictors of the future risk of a SEE. Thus, the risk of a SEE in a future period can be predicted by a supervised machine learning method. Predicting the high risk of a SEE improves the daily work of each inspector by focusing only on high-risk SEEs.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用机器学习方法预测社会企业（SEEs）的风险，这属于金融风险管理中的信用风险评估范畴。论文明确提到预测SEE的高风险以帮助监管机构优化检查资源，这与金融风险管理中的风险识别和监控目标一致。
